N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 72-1.4 - Permits and fees

State Regulations
(a) The PIO shall issue a permit to a person who meets the requirements of these rules and submits an application on a form prescribed by the State Commissioner of Health along with payment of a $ 120 registration fee per biennial registration period and an inspection fee as specified in section
72-1.5
(b) of this Subpart; (b) A permit issued pursuant to these rules shall be issued to a specific applicant for a specified location and shall be effective for no more than two years from the date of issuance. (c) Permits may be issued for a period of less than two years, with appropriate proration of the registration fee at the rate of $ 5.00 per month or each portion of a month thereof.; (d) The PIO may stagger biennial registration periods among tanning facilities as needed to effectively administer permits within their jurisdiction. The PIO may choose to stagger periods by date of application, by size of regulated facility, by geographic location, or by some other classification or grouping determined by the PIO. (e) When registration periods are staggered, the first registration period shall be January 1st through June 30th and the second period shall be July 1st through December 31st, or some other scheme may be used as determined by the PIO to effectively administer permits within their jurisdiction. (f) Operators of tanning facilities shall obtain a permit before beginning operation. (g) Each permit shall include but not be limited to the following: one facility name, one facility location, name of owner/operator, registration period and name of PIO. (h) A permit is not transferable from one person to another or from one establishment location to another. (i) The permit shall be conspicuously posted within the tanning facility. Notes
